positions.description: Led design and development of Chassis components for various Military configured vehicles to be used in Iraq and Afghanistan. Managed 10 engineers and designers, as well as 3 other functional groups. Facilitated meetings with suppliers, sharing ‚Äúmusts‚Äù and ‚Äúwants‚Äù on components to be utilized in vehicles. Directed design team on DRDs and critical performance criteria specifications.‚Ä¢ Reviewed truck specifications and created labor estimates for 10 chassis engineers and designers, ensuring completion of identified tasks.‚Ä¢ Conducted coaching and annual performance reviews for 3 team members, resulting in 2 recommended promotions.‚Ä¢ Facilitated weekly design reviews with dedicated team designers and engineers, addressing and resolving issues that proved to reduce design costs and meet release dates.‚Ä¢ Accompanied team members at Garland and West Point manufacturing facilities for pilot builds, identifying and fixing issues thus eliminating delays in line set for additional builds.‚Ä¢ Created average of 2-3 bids per month, including labor estimates and vehicle design proposals for various customers, providing necessary information vital to decision making.
positions.description_html:
Led design and development of Chassis components for various Military configured vehicles to be used in Iraq and Afghanistan. Managed 10 engineers and designers, as well as 3 other functional groups. Facilitated meetings with suppliers, sharing “musts” and “wants” on components to be utilized in vehicles. Directed design team on DRDs and critical performance criteria specifications.
• Reviewed truck specifications and created labor estimates for 10 chassis engineers and designers, ensuring completion of identified tasks.
• Conducted coaching and annual performance reviews for 3 team members, resulting in 2 recommended promotions.
• Facilitated weekly design reviews with dedicated team designers and engineers, addressing and resolving issues that proved to reduce design costs and meet release dates.
• Accompanied team members at Garland and West Point manufacturing facilities for pilot builds, identifying and fixing issues thus eliminating delays in line set for additional builds.
• Created average of 2-3 bids per month, including labor estimates and vehicle design proposals for various customers, providing necessary information vital to decision making.

positions.description: Represented Chassis Engineering in determining root cause of warranty and cost reduction idea evaluations over all truck models. Warranty issues varied but averaged approximately 30 per month. Cost reduction ideas reviewed averaged 200-300 per month. However after initial review, the actual number to be considered was approximately 50% of initial count.‚Ä¢ Active participant in 8 D analysis in determining root cause of warranty component failure. Abbreviated 8Ds were generated for each warranty failure.‚Ä¢ Reviewed FEA analysis and made recommendations on correcting warranty failures. STAG group performed an average of 10 analysis per month.‚Ä¢ Coordinated warranty improvements with cross functional groups that included Purchasing, Manufacturing and Suppliers of components.‚Ä¢ Managed design reviews for improvements of failed components and cost savings ideas. Leveraged new designs off of existing designs thus reducing improved implementation timing.
positions.description_html:
Represented Chassis Engineering in determining root cause of warranty and cost reduction idea evaluations over all truck models. Warranty issues varied but averaged approximately 30 per month. Cost reduction ideas reviewed averaged 200-300 per month. However after initial review, the actual number to be considered was approximately 50% of initial count.
• Active participant in 8 D analysis in determining root cause of warranty component failure. Abbreviated 8Ds were generated for each warranty failure.
• Reviewed FEA analysis and made recommendations on correcting warranty failures. STAG group performed an average of 10 analysis per month.
• Coordinated warranty improvements with cross functional groups that included Purchasing, Manufacturing and Suppliers of components.
• Managed design reviews for improvements of failed components and cost savings ideas. Leveraged new designs off of existing designs thus reducing improved implementation timing.

about: I'm a competent, conscientious and versatile administrator/customer service assistant who‚Ä¶

experience.description: In my current role i liaise with all engineers in the North West and Midlands. Arranging returns of faulty parts by contacting the engineers to return them. If they've ben left on site as they're too big to fit in the engineer's car then i phone the customer to get further information address, contact name etc,. and then phone the courier to arrange a collection of the parts. If the part is lost on a customer site or the engineer has lost the part, I then have to escalate this to a customer manager or engineer manager using the escalation process. I run daily reports off the internal system to see what parts are outstanding and the cost of them and input my own comments on their progress.While I've been working here I've picked up some key skills great customer service, including problem solving and advanced excel in Microsoft.I also gained a NVQ Level 3 Business Administration.
experience.description_html:
In my current role i liaise with all engineers in the North West and Midlands.

Arranging returns of faulty parts by contacting the engineers to return them. If they've ben left on site as they're too big to fit in the engineer's car then i phone the customer to get further information address, contact name etc,. and then phone the courier to arrange a collection of the parts. If the part is lost on a customer site or the engineer has lost the part, I then have to escalate this to a customer manager or engineer manager using the escalation process.

I run daily reports off the internal system to see what parts are outstanding and the cost of them and input my own comments on their progress.

While I've been working here I've picked up some key skills great customer service, including problem solving and advanced excel in Microsoft.

I also gained a NVQ Level 3 Business Administration.
